questions.explanation: for the persistence of a two-party system in the United States is (A) the lack of divisive issues in United States politics (B) the separation of powers (C) the single-member district electoral system (D) the lack of a strong labor movement (E) low voter turnout in most elections

questions.question: One reason for the persistence of a two-party system in the United States is
options: the lack of divisive issues in United States politics
the lack of a strong labor movement

questions.question: Both Gitlow v. New York and New York Times v. Sullivan are United States Supreme Court cases that dealt with which of the following amendments to the United States Constitution?
Which of the following is true of political action committees (PACs)?
options: They are a part of political party organiza­ tions.
They make campaign contributions to gain access to legislators.
They are allowed to contribute to only one candidate in a given contest.
They effectively control the presidential campaigns.

questions.question: All of the following are ways that the legislative branch can check the powers of the executive branch EXCEPT:
options: ongress may pass a law declaring a presi­ dential action unconstitutional.
The Senate may refuse to approve a presi­ dential appointment.

questions.question: How is a president chosen when none of the candidates receives a majority of the electoral college vote?
options: There is a national runoff election between the two candidates with the greatest number of electoral votes.
The Senate chooses a new president by a majority vote of its entire membership.

questions.question: The Americans with Disabilities Act, which provides protections for the disabled, is an example of
Which of the following best describes the difference between an open and closed primary?
options: Voters must pay a poll tax to vote in a closed primary, but not in an open primary.
Voters are allowed to split their ticket in a closed primary but not in an open primary.
andidates must seek the approval of the party organization to run in a closed primary, but anyone may be a candidate in an open primary.
Open primaries require a run-off system, while closed primaries do not.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of political efficacy?
options: It is the belief that an intelligent voting decision cannot be made without information.
It is the belief that the media must provide unbiased information for citizens to be able to make well-informed choices.
It is. the belief that one can make a difference in politics by expressing an opinion and acting politically.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about motions for cloture is true?

They are applied to bills that failed in the previous session of

questions.question: Which of the following describes a fundamental difference between political parties and interest groups?
options: Political parties are prohibited from sponsoring campaign advertisements, and interest groups are not.
Political parties represent broad arrays of issues, whereas interest groups are more likely to focus on narrow sets of issues.
Political parties are more likely to focus on national politics, whereas interest groups focus on local politics.
Political parties tend to have strength in particular regions, whereas the power of interest groups is more consistent across states.

questions.question: To which characteristic of American government does the term “federalism” refer?
options: The system of checks and balances within the national government
ill of Rights’ protection of the rights of the accused

questions.question: The swift adoption of the Bill of Rights in the years following ratification of the Constitution demonstrates the
options: Framers’ unqualified commitment to individual rights
small states’ determination to receive equal representation in the legislature
states’ fears of an overpowerful national government

questions.question: Which of the following is true of court cases in which one private party is suing another?
options: They are tried in civil court.
The federal court system has exclusive jurisdiction over them.
They are tried in criminal court.
The state court system has exclusive jurisdiction over them.

questions.question: The term “budget deficit” refers to the
options: annual increase in federal spending on the military
amount of interest on the national debt
period after the fiscal year ends during which the government operates without an official budget
